info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 28 at 1:19AM EST until December 28 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Perkiomen Creek At Graterford affecting Montgomery County. For the Perkiomen Creek...including Graterford...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Perkiomen Creek at Graterford. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Park Avenue in Schwenksville is flooded. The Perkiomen Trail is flooded in Perkiomen Township at Plank Road and Route 113. At 11.0 feet, Graterford Road and Penitentiary Bridge are closed due to flooding. At 12.0 feet, Portions of Central Perkiomen Park in Collegeville are flooded. Flood waters expand onto and to the west of First Avenue in Collegeville. At 13.0 feet, First Avenue in Collegeville becomes impassable. At 14.0 feet, Storm sewers back up in Collegeville and flood Route 29. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:02 AM EST Thursday the stage was 11.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:02 AM EST Thursday was 11.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.2 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this morning. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.2 feet on 09/27/1985. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Stg Time Date Perkiomen Creek Graterford 11.0 11.1 Thu 1 am 5.1 3.3 13.2 7am 12/28 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM EST.
